dialogues.dialogue_tamil: சென்னை ட்ராஃபிக் என்னோட கார்டியோ
dialogues.dialogue_english: Chennai traffic is my cardio, bro!
dialogues.context: Modern, relatable humor about Chennai traffic jams
dialogues.dialogue_tanglish: Chennai traffic ennoda cardio, bro!

dialogues.dialogue_tamil: இதெல்லாம் ரொம்ப over்னு எனக்கே தெரியும்
dialogues.dialogue_english: I know all this is very over, but what to do?
dialogues.context: Meta-humor acknowledging the absurdity of the situation
dialogues.dialogue_tanglish: Idhellam romba over-nu enakkay theriyum, aana enna pandradhu!

dialogues.dialogue_tamil: காதல் என்றால் கஷ்டம்தான்
dialogues.dialogue_english: Love means suffering, that's the universal truth!
dialogues.context: Cynical, humorous take on romantic relationships
dialogues.dialogue_tanglish: Kaadhal-na kashtam dhan, adhu universal truth!

dialogues.dialogue_tamil: Office politics-அ விட குடும்ப politics-அ ஈஸி
dialogues.dialogue_english: Family politics is easier than office politics, at least you know your enemies!
dialogues.context: Relatable workplace humor with sharp observations
dialogues.dialogue_tanglish: Office politics-a vida kudumba politics easy, atleast unga enemies theriyum!

dialogues.dialogue_tamil: Style இருந்தா substance இருக்கணும்னு அவசியம் இல்ல
dialogues.dialogue_english: If you have style, substance is optional, bro!
dialogues.context: Confident, cool delivery of witty observation
dialogues.dialogue_tanglish: Style irundhaa substance irukanumnu avasiyam illa, bro!

dialogues.dialogue_tamil: Facebook-ல எல்லாரும் happy, real life-ல எல்லாரும் tense
dialogues.dialogue_english: On Facebook everyone is happy, in real life everyone is tense!
dialogues.context: Modern observation about social media vs reality
dialogues.dialogue_tanglish: Facebook-la ellarum happy, real life-la ellarum tense!

dialogues.dialogue_tamil: First date-ல coffee shop போனா safe, restaurant போனா commitment
dialogues.dialogue_english: First date at coffee shop is safe, restaurant means commitment, bro!
dialogues.context: Modern dating wisdom with comic logic
dialogues.dialogue_tanglish: First date-la coffee shop ponaa safe, restaurant ponaa commitment, bro!

dialogues.dialogue_tamil: நண்பன் வீட்ல சாப்பிட்டா அது நட்பு, அவன் பணம் எடுத்தா அது திருட்டு
dialogues.dialogue_english: Eating at friend's house is friendship, taking his money is theft - thin line, bro!
dialogues.context: Cynical but funny take on friendship boundaries
dialogues.dialogue_tanglish: Nanbaa veetla saapittaa adhu friendship, avan panam eduththaa adhu theft - thin line, bro!

dialogues.dialogue_tamil: நல்லா இருக்கறவன் கஷ்டப்படுவான், கெட்டவன் enjoy பண்ணுவான்
dialogues.dialogue_english: Good people suffer, bad people enjoy - that's the system, bro!
dialogues.context: Dark humor about moral injustice in life
dialogues.dialogue_tanglish: Nallaa irukkaravaan kashtapaduvaaan, kettavan enjoy pannuvaaan - that's the system, bro!

dialogues.dialogue_tamil: படத்துல logic தேடறவனுக்கு comedy புரியாது
dialogues.dialogue_english: If you look for logic in movies, you won't enjoy the comedy, bro!
dialogues.context: Meta-humor about cinema and audience expectations
dialogues.dialogue_tanglish: Padathula logic thedaavanukkku comedy puriyaadhu, bro!

dialogues.dialogue_tamil: Smartphone வந்த பிறகு people smart ஆகல, phone மட்டும் smart ஆச்சு
dialogues.dialogue_english: After smartphones came, people didn't get smart, only the phone got smart!
dialogues.context: Witty observation on technology and intelligence
dialogues.dialogue_tanglish: Smartphone vandha piragu people smart aagala, phone mattum smart aachu!

dialogues.dialogue_tamil: Chennai-ல வாழ்றதுக்கு three முக்கியம்: patience, AC, and more patience
dialogues.dialogue_english: To live in Chennai you need three things: patience, AC, and more patience!
dialogues.context: Relatable humor about Chennai's heat and chaos
dialogues.dialogue_tanglish: Chennai-la vaazhradhukku three mukkiyam: patience, AC, and more patience!

dialogues.dialogue_tamil: Roommate கிட்ட privacy இருக்காது, ஆனா rent share ஆகும்
dialogues.dialogue_english: With roommate no privacy, but rent is shared - tough choice, bro!
dialogues.context: Modern struggles of city living and compromises
dialogues.dialogue_tanglish: Roommate kitta privacy irukkaadhu, aana rent share aagum - tough choice, bro!

dialogues.dialogue_tamil: பணம் இல்லாதவன் பார்த்தா எல்லாமே expensive
dialogues.dialogue_english: When you're broke, even a vada feels expensive, bro!
dialogues.context: Relatable humor about financial struggles
dialogues.dialogue_tanglish: Panam illadhavan paarthaa ellamey expensive, bro!

dialogues.dialogue_tamil: எல்லாரும் வெற்றி பெறனும்னு சொல்றாங்க, ஆனா competition-ல நான் மட்டும் ஜெயிக்கணும்
dialogues.dialogue_english: Everyone says may the best person win, but actually I should win!
dialogues.context: Honest admission of competitive selfishness
dialogues.dialogue_tanglish: Ellarum success peranumnu solraanga, aana competition-la naan mattum win aaganum!

dialogues.dialogue_tamil: Trip plan பண்ணும் போது எல்லாமே நல்லா இருக்கும், போன பிறகு தான் reality
dialogues.dialogue_english: Planning a trip everything looks good, reality hits only after you go!
dialogues.context: Relatable humor about travel expectations vs reality
dialogues.dialogue_tanglish: Trip plan pannum podhu ellamey nalla irukkum, pona piragu dhan reality!

dialogues.dialogue_tamil: பேரு வச்சிருக்காங்க Rocket, ஆனா speed இல்ல
dialogues.dialogue_english: They named me Rocket, but I have no speed - irony at its peak!
dialogues.context: Self-deprecating humor about mismatched nicknames
dialogues.dialogue_tanglish: Peru vechirukkaanga Rocket, aana speed illa - irony at its peak!

dialogues.dialogue_tamil: Hero வாறதுக்கு முன்னாடி நானும் ஓடலாம், ஆனா scene வேணுமே
dialogues.dialogue_english: I could run before the hero comes, but then no scene for me, bro!
dialogues.context: Meta-humor about sidekick role in movies
dialogues.dialogue_tanglish: Hero varadhukku munnaadi naanum odalaam, aana scene venumey, bro!

dialogues.dialogue_tamil: சமையல் பண்ண தெரியாதவன் marriage பண்ணிக்கணும்
dialogues.dialogue_english: If you can't cook, get married - simple solution, bro!
dialogues.context: Practical life advice with comedic honesty
dialogues.dialogue_tanglish: Samayal panna theriyaadhavan marriage pannikanum - simple solution, bro!

dialogues.dialogue_tamil: Gym போறவன் photo போடுவான், workout பண்ணலைனாலும் paravala
dialogues.dialogue_english: Gym people will post photos even without workout - it's all about the flex!
dialogues.context: Modern satire on social media fitness culture
dialogues.dialogue_tanglish: Gym poravan photo poduvaan, workout pannalainaalum paravala - it's all about the flex!

dialogues.dialogue_tamil: ஊர்ல respect, சென்னைல competition
dialogues.dialogue_english: In village you get respect, in Chennai it's all competition!
dialogues.context: Contrast between rural values and urban reality
dialogues.dialogue_tanglish: Ooru-la respect, Chennai-la competition!

dialogues.dialogue_tamil: Online shopping-ல photo வேற மாதிரி, delivery வேற மாதிரி
dialogues.dialogue_english: Online shopping: photo shows one thing, delivery brings something else!
dialogues.context: Modern e-commerce frustrations with humor
dialogues.dialogue_tanglish: Online shopping-la photo vera madhiri, delivery vera madhiri!

dialogues.dialogue_tamil: Customer எப்பவும் right-னு சொல்றாங்க, ஆனா customer எப்பவும் confusing
dialogues.dialogue_english: They say customer is always right, but customer is always confusing!
dialogues.context: Workplace humor about difficult customers
dialogues.dialogue_tanglish: Customer eppavum right-nu solraanga, aana customer eppavum confusing!

dialogues.scene_description: Humorous lament about having only one friend.
dialogues.dialogue_english: Those who have ten to fifteen friends in town are happy... The plight I'm in with just one friend... Oh my oh my oh my...!
dialogues.context: Humorous lament about having only one friend.
dialogues.dialogue_tanglish: Oorla Paththu Pathinanji Friend Vachirukavan Ellam Santhosama Irukan....Ore Oru Frienda Vachikittu Nan Padra Avastha Iruke.....Ayu Ayu Ayu..Uu..

dialogues.scene_description: Trying to understand women, then giving up and asking for a drink.
dialogues.dialogue_english: Every girl has a different feeling, machi... Get me a quarter (bottle of alcohol)...
dialogues.context: Trying to understand women, then giving up and asking for a drink.
dialogues.dialogue_tanglish: Ovvoru Ponnukkum Ovvoru Feeling Machi... Oru Quarter Sollaen...

dialogues.dialogue_english: Today Sathyam Theatre is a cool place, bustling. Tomorrow Mahabalipuram is a hot place, also bustling.
dialogues.context: Comparing two different places/experiences.
dialogues.dialogue_tanglish: Today Sathyam Theatre Cool Place Gaja Gaja . . Tomorrow Hot Place Mahapalipuram Ah Gaja Gaja . .

dialogues.scene_description: A statement about the delayed impact of good intentions or words.
dialogues.dialogue_english: Good people's dialogues will reach... but it will be a little late!!
dialogues.context: A statement about the delayed impact of good intentions or words.
dialogues.dialogue_tanglish: Nallavanga Dialogue Reach Agum.. Aana Konjam Late Agum!!

dialogues.dialogue_english: You borrowed money for beer yesterday, first give that back.
dialogues.context: Humorous demand for borrowed money.
dialogues.dialogue_tanglish: Nethu Beer Adika Kasu Vanginiyae Atha Mothala Thirupi Kodu.

dialogues.scene_description: Sarcastic comment about someone's unsuccessful love life.
dialogues.dialogue_english: It's fine if you go and propose love. You are just going to watch the explosion (of rejection).
dialogues.context: Sarcastic comment about someone's unsuccessful love life.
dialogues.dialogue_tanglish: Nee Poi Love Sonna Paravala.Neeye Vedikathan Paka Pora

dialogues.scene_description: Humorous generalization about the unreliability of words from drunkards and women.
dialogues.dialogue_english: A drunkard's words are gone by morning... A woman's words are gone as soon as they are said.
dialogues.context: Humorous generalization about the unreliability of words from drunkards and women.
dialogues.dialogue_tanglish: Kudigaaran Pechi Vidinja Dhaa Pochi.. Ponunga Pechi Sonna Odanae Pochi

dialogues.scene_description: A rhyming request for drinks and snacks.
dialogues.dialogue_english: Stop stop, come running... bring a quarter bottle of liquor, Chicken 65 by weight... pour two pegs, one for us... another peg for Sakthi Aunty...
dialogues.context: A rhyming request for drinks and snacks.
dialogues.dialogue_tanglish: Nilla Nilla Odi Va......Quater Saraku Konduva Chicken 65 Weightu..Rendu Pegu Oothu Oru Pegu Engaluku......Innoru Pegu Sakthi Auntyku......

dialogues.scene_description: Sarcastic retort to being judged for unemployment.
dialogues.dialogue_english: Just because I didn't study or go to work, why do you all look down on me? Are you the owner of Docomo Company or what?
dialogues.context: Sarcastic retort to being judged for unemployment.
dialogues.dialogue_tanglish: Naan Padikalae Vaelaiku Pogalaenu Unagaluku Ellam Enna Kanda Kevalama Irukula Pinna Docomo Company Owner Ah Nee ?

dialogues.scene_description: Emotional confession to a friend during a tense moment, seeking solace in beer.
dialogues.dialogue_english: There's a lot of tension... Let's go have a beer... Dai, Chandrika didn't understand me as much as you did... You are my friend, da...
dialogues.context: Emotional confession to a friend during a tense moment, seeking solace in beer.
dialogues.dialogue_tanglish: Paynakara Tension A Irrukuta.....Vada Poyi Oru Beeru Sapitalam.....Dai Nee Ennai Purinjikita Alavu Koda Chandrika Ennai Purinjikalaiya Da..........Ne En Nanbean Da.....

dialogues.scene_description: Humorous description of a character, highlighting a quirky food habit despite a serious profession.
dialogues.dialogue_english: What does Sir do? Sir works as an English Professor in college... He only eats Pizza, Burger.
dialogues.context: Humorous description of a character, highlighting a quirky food habit despite a serious profession.
dialogues.dialogue_tanglish: Sir Enna Panraru? Saaru College'la English Professor'a Vela Seiraru.... Only Pizza, Burger Dhaan Saapuduvaru
